definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: The anti-aircraft guns riddled the plane's wings with bullets.
sentences.chinese: 防空炮把機翼打得彈痕累累。

sentences.english: The gatehouse on the street, so far still ringing in binoculars.
sentences.chinese: 臨街的門樓上，至今彈痕猶在。

sentences.english: Outside the museum, two bullet- riddled cars round out the story.
sentences.chinese: 在博物館外面，兩輛彈痕累累的汽車講述着這個故事。

sentences.english: The concrete surface of the road was riddled with bullets.
sentences.chinese: 馬路上的水泥地面，彈痕累累。

sentences.english: There were many more bullet-scarred and derelict houses.
sentences.chinese: 被廢棄的彈痕累累的房屋更多了。

sentences.english: The bullet holes on the bridge bear witness to a period of history.
sentences.chinese: 橋上的累累彈痕是一段歷史的見證。

definition: lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight/also written 觸目驚心|触目惊心
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
extraordinary strength/super strong/strong as an ox
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
lit. bleak wind and icy rain (idiom)/fig. hardships/miserable circumstances
